benchmark_details.name: DisasterQA
benchmark_details.overview: DisasterQA is an open source benchmark designed to evaluate the performance of large language models (LLMs) on disaster response knowledge, created from multiple online sources.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: The goal of DisasterQA is to assess the capabilities of LLMs in disaster response and to encourage further development of these models in the field.
purpose_and_intended_users.limitations: The benchmark consists of 707 questions, which could be expanded.

data.source: Data was compiled from six online sources including Quizlet, Scribd, YouTube, Quizizz, Slideshare, and Online PDFs.

methodology.calculation: Accuracy was calculated based on first index accuracy and majority vote accuracy.
methodology.interpretation: A higher accuracy indicates better performance of the LLMs in disaster response knowledge.
